alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Columbiana; Coshocton; Harrison; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 7:14AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HARRISON...WESTERN COLUMBIANA...NORTHEASTERN COSHOCTON...CARROLL AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 815 AM EDT... At 713 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Millersburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Uhrichsville, Carrollton, Minerva, Dennison, Strasburg, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Malvern, Tuscarawas, and Bolivar. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 70 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
